title: Business Mathematics Project-Based Instruction Utilizing Anchored Teaching Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary arithmetic operations, statistical concepts, and comprehension of simple financial statements
context.additional_context: Context-Based Problem-Solving Environment Utilizing Digital Devices with Real Business Scenarios

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically design sales forecasting models by analyzing real-world business cases
Learners can perform break-even analysis and decision-making simulations using financial statement data

In a four-person project team, learners analyze a complex business problem (e.g., inventory optimization, demand forecasting) and complete deliverables meeting the following conditions within four weeks according to a six-step problem-solving process (problem definition → data collection → modeling → verification → action plan development → result evaluation): 1) a 15-page project report (structured table of contents, including at least three data visualizations), 2) a 10-minute presentation (including five slides summarizing key results), 3) an average score of 4 points or higher (out of 5) in a team evaluation rubric (five items: problem-solving appropriateness, data utilization, creativity, etc.).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
